alert.note: Alert for Muskogee; Okmulgee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 7:18AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern McIntosh, southeastern Okmulgee and northwestern Muskogee Counties through 800 AM CDT... At 718 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Dewar to 5 miles northeast of Dustin. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Henryetta... Checotah... Dewar... Schulter... Boynton... Grayson... Council Hill... Hoffman... Stidham... Lake Eufaula State Park... Wainwright... Hitchita... Pierce... Eram... Onapa... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 237 and 263. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
